body:
You said there's one machine in production environment, why you provide a mac hardware environment?
Is all data in this issue based on the mac?

Yes, the machine on which the program runs is mac, but the database is a database instance based on Alibaba Cloud.
The machine load is below 2.0.
mac os 6 core 16G.
At present, it is in the testing stage, and there are no machines produced on it

sharding:
      default-data-source-name: ds0
      tables:
        t_user:
          actual-data-nodes: ds3.t_user
The performance of the machine where the program is located is no problem, and the configuration of the daily database may be lower.

> Or try with a back quota:
> 
> > `source`
error message：
mismatched input 'source' expecting {TRUNCATE, ..., IDENTIFIER_}
I don’t quite understand what you mean. Are you saying that the sub-library and sub-table are not available? If so, please post the complete YML configuration and the sharding-jdbc version number.
What's the latency between the cloud service and your mac?
Are you referring to the cloud service database?
Add reference to https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/6166 .
You can ping the cloud host from your mac.

@pengweizhong Hi have you ever looked at [sharding+encryption configuration example](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/legacy/4.x/document/cn/manual/sharding-jdbc/configuration/config-spring-boot/#data-sharding--data-masking)?

Hi  @JOYS369 
`source` did not work, did it?

@tristaZero Yes, I have turned it over many times. A single function can be used, such as data desensitization or sub-database sub-table. But when they are used together, it is not allowed.
For example, the current situation: through the console log, you can see that the data desensitization function is normal, but you cannot find the specific physical table when inserting the data. Because the previously used sub-library sub-table strategy can not be used.

> did not work, did it?

Hi,I tried it , change 'SOURCE' to 'source'。Still reporting errors。
analogous error message：
mismatched input 'source' expecting {TRUNCATE, ..., IDENTIFIER_}
The local delay is relatively high within 20ms, so I will apply for a daily machine and test it again.

```
[INFO ColumnMetaDataLoader:84] - load column metadata for table=t1 use 192.2264ms
[INFO IndexMetaDataLoader:62] - load index metadata for table=t1 use 38.0993ms
[INFO ColumnMetaDataLoader:84] - load column metadata for table=t2 use 392.8141ms
[INFO IndexMetaDataLoader:62] - load index metadata for table=t2 use 37.5664ms
[INFO ColumnMetaDataLoader:84] - load column metadata for table=t3 use 267.1177ms
[INFO IndexMetaDataLoader:62] - load index metadata for table=t3 use 38.5584ms
[INFO ColumnMetaDataLoader:84] - load column metadata for table=t4 use 500.384ms
[INFO IndexMetaDataLoader:62] - load index metadata for table=t4 use 38.3369ms
```

Using 5.0-RC1 -SNAPSHOT, add some metric code in ColumnMetaDataLoader.load and IndexMetaDataLoader.load.

The time is not related to the number of columns .

Properties:
```
max.connections.size.per.query: '10'
sql.show: 'true'
check.table.metadata.enabled: 'false'
```

Client pings to db server: 29ms
Fixed via https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/pull/6202 .
Duplicate with https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/6166 .

@tristaZero 
Hello, the following is the output of the console when data desensitization is configured and not configured.
![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48546556/85994424-5b37d580-ba2a-11ea-8efa-2c247e73bcf7.png)
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48546556/85994434-5f63f300-ba2a-11ea-8274-80f3f46fa18c.png)
Duplicate with #6166 .
Fixed via #6202 .
Please help me @pengweizhong . You can review my console logs.

thanks for your suggestion. but i think it's not a question.
1. database-strategy and the table-strategy are not a one by one pair.
2. you can also wrap the two methods as a class.

> The local delay is relatively high within 20ms, so I will apply for a daily machine and test it again.

OK. Wait for your response. When you start the test, please record the load of servers for both MySQL and ShardingSphere.
duplicated with https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/5925
@hand515 I noticed that ColumnMetaDataLoader.load is more slower than IndexMetaDataLoader.load. I'll check.
`ShardingRule` is supposed to include `EncryptRule`. However, from your configuration, it looks like `ShardingRule` and `EncryptRule` are at the same level. Please double check.
@swayamraina any problems?

load average: 1.27, 0.51, 0.22
On average, it takes 35m's to load metadata every time.
Machine and database delay is about 0.09ms
What's the load average for? MySQL or ShardingSphere? Please record the load of servers for both MySQL and ShardingSphere.
The average server load in ShardingSphere is around 1.1

What's the total time this time?
Set the property spring.shardingsphere.props.max.connections.size.per.query to 1/2/4/8/16/32/64, record the log and show me the total time.

Compare to 
`2020-06-24 11:58:01.251 INFO 61443 --- [ main] ShardingSphere-metadata : Meta data load finished, cost 1222709 milliseconds.
`
What's the cost this time?
Set the property spring.shardingsphere.props.max.connections.size.per.query to 1, cost 258084 milliseconds
Set the property spring.shardingsphere.props.max.connections.size.per.query to 64,  database load is basically running at full load, and the cpu is full
Not only the 1 and 64. Please try 1/2/4/8/16/32/64.

I have captured some packets and studied the codes. There're 7 SQLs sent to MySQL every table for meta data purpose. In your case, there're 7 * 7169 = 50183 SQLs to be executed. The average response time is 258084 / 50183 = 5 ms. It's slow but acceptable if your server has only 4 cores.

The conclusion is that you can adjust spring.shardingsphere.props.max.connections.size.per.query to a suitable value to make the initialization faster without full load. Meanwhile, I will try to reduce the interaction times during meta data procedure.

I am focused on this problem too. You can refer to https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/6179 .

Any idea?

According to mysql jdbc driver(mysql-connector-java:5.1.34) , load metadata will execute 4 sql (use wireshark to capture)
```
TableMetaDataLoader.isTableExists
1. show full tables from db_name like '%'   

ColumnMetaDataLoader
1. show full columns from table_name.
2. select * from table_name where 1!=1
IndexMetaDataLoader
1. show index from table_name

```

@hand515 There are 3 more:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24643893/86014328-c4cbda00-ba52-11ea-93ee-525db294400d.png)

**I think we can solve this in two ways:** 
1. for my case, one app load a few tables,  can we just add a config to specify which tables want to load ? 
2. another way is can we use lazy load ?   I means loading table metadata when first used,  for the lazy load, it will affect the performance for the first sql execution , this will be a trade off
I prefer the second solution,  lazy load
Well, I'll try debugging. Will the optimization you mentioned be iterated in subsequent versions?
Yes, will exist in next release.
@KaiRyoung @zhaolin81 Hi, can you try to upgrade to version 4.1.1? I have tried version 4.1.1 with Sharding-Proxy, the `DATE_FORMAT()` function is ok.

> > did not work, did it?
> 
> Hi,I tried it , change 'SOURCE' to 'source'。Still reporting errors。
> analogous error message：
> mismatched input 'source' expecting {TRUNCATE, ..., IDENTIFIER_}

I tried use table's alias, update data sucess.
but, log also has error message,
line 1:136 no viable alternative at input 'CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,'
line 1:136 no viable alternative at input 'CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,'
line 1:828 mismatched input 'source' expecting  {TRUNCATE, ..., IDENTIFIER_}


Do you know how to slave first question?
1、the project can start Running in MAC ，but can't start Running in window.（Multiple computers tests，It's all like this）
It's very inconvenient，because I need to user other computer to test.

When a ‘‘Error querying database.’ exception occurs, first you need to check whether the SQL statement is queried across databases. In this case, SHARDING is not supported. For details, [please refer to the official documentation.](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/cn/features/sharding/use-norms/sql/#%E4%B8%8D%E6%94%AF%E6%8C%81%E7%9A%84sql)
If it is not the above behavior, then check:

1. Whether SQL can be run locally.
2.  Check whether the query table name is a logical table name or a physical table name, if it is a logical table name, please check your code configuration
@EasonFeng5870 Hi Thanks for your PR, @terrymanu will take charge of the review, please give him some time. :)
Everything works well on Mac, however, does not work well on win?
@jingshanglu Hi, could you give a look at his SQL, especially the keywords `source` and`CURRENT_TIMESTAMP `? Do you think there is something wrong with sharding parser?

I can't reproduce this issue. @DongJigong 

And in the latest version 5.x, we will force all dsXX in a same schema/table structure.

BTW: this is not a supported feature.
> I have to database with ds0 and ds3, the database ds0 configed as default database, table user belongs to ds0 but the
table ums_claims belongs to ds3.
@JOYS369 @tristaZero  There is no wrong with sharding parser, i have tried it. Now everything works well on Mac, may be the problem with the windows environment.

few tables metadata or lazy-load, all lead to the one of :
1、unconsistent metadata status
2、pending first query for metadata load

Regarding the configuration level, I have tried many times in different situations. According to the configuration you said, SPRINGBOOT-YML does not recognize it directly, and the data desensitization does not take effect after the program is run.
Existing configuration:
```yml
spring:
   shardingsphere:
     encrypt:
         . . .
```
Data desensitization takes effect, sub-database sub-table does not take effect
```yml
spring:
   shardingsphere:
     sharding:
       encrypt:
         . . .
```
Data desensitization does not take effect, the sub-database sub-table takes effect. In addition, IDEA will prompt that _"this part of the configuration does not exist"_. What is the problem? Or is Sharding not friendly enough for SPRINGBOOT-YML? Should I choose YML configuration or PROPERTIES configuration in a production environment?
thanks

> @JOYS369 @tristaZero There is no wrong with sharding parser, i have tried it. Now everything works well on Mac, may be the problem with the windows environment.

project can't start Running in window；
the second question is found Running in MAC.

for the single table metadata load, most of the latency time with be 1-4ms,  for most case I think it is ok. 
for the inconsistent metadata status,  it is acceptable 

can we make the table load policy multi choose for user, not just load all tables, 
this is also unacceptable in service mesh scene, which required elastic scale in and out.
excuse me, What's the solution of the bug?
@JOYS369 @tristaZero Well , i reproduce it, the pr #6211 fix it. new version will fix it.

> > > Hi @JOYS369 you can try the newest version `4.1.1`.
> > 
> > 
> > Hi, I tried it，but can't start the project .
> > mismatched input 'text' expecting {TRUNCATE, ..., IDENTIFIER_}
> 
> @JOYS369 use version '4.1.1' ,will the second question occur? i have tried it on mysql use '4.1.1' , it's ok. Can you show more detail info(eg:log stack).

 I tried it，but can't start the project use version 4.1.1 （window and MAC）. 
It will throw an errormismatched input 'text' expecting {TRUNCATE, ..., IDENTIFIER_}

so I use version '4.0.1',my computer is window10，my partner computer is MAC
1、the project can start Running in MAC ，but can't start Running in window.（Multiple computers tests，It's all like this）
It's very inconvenient，because I need to user other computer to test.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8855265/86102922-b6330080-baee-11ea-9fe7-faa3245e999b.png)
If I change to this way below it works fine.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8855265/86103114-eda1ad00-baee-11ea-909d-611b314501a3.png)
` # and $ `

@strongduanmu  Hi, I use sharding-jdbc. The function with DATE_FORMAT version 4.1.1 cannot be fragmented, but the 4.0.1 version can be fragmented normally; I mean that the DATE_FORMAT can be fragmented after removing the 4.1.1 version, and it will not work when it is added, my score The slice key is shard_time. The SQL is as follows:
`SELECT
	MAX( t.id ) id,
	MAX( t.taskid ) taskid,
	MAX( t.entid ) entid,
	MAX( t.planstime ) planstime,
	MAX( t.planetime ) planetime,
	MAX( t.gettime ) gettime,
	MAX( t.acttime ) acttime,
	MAX( t.phone ) phone,
	MAX( t.NAME ) NAME,
	MAX( t.`call` ) `call`,
	MAX( t.duration ) duration,
	MAX( t.filename ) filename,
	MAX( t.breaknode ) breaknode,
	MAX( t.callEndreason ) callEndreason,
	MAX( t.adduser ) adduser,
	MAX( t.`addtime` ) `addtime`,
	MAX( t.state ) state,
	MAX( t.weight ) weight,
	MAX( t.flag ) flag,
	MAX( t.remark ) remark,
	MAX( t.artificialweight ) artificialweight,
	MAX( t.signread ) signread,
	MAX( t.weightlevel ) weightlevel,
	MAX( t.shard_time ) shard_time,
	MAX( c.purposesum ) score,
	MAX( c.switchartificial ) switchArtificial,
	MAX( c.switch_artificial_num ) switch_artificial_num,
	MAX( c.fwid ) fwid 
FROM
	ttaskdetail t
	LEFT JOIN t_callinfo c ON t.id = c.taskdeid 
WHERE
	t.taskid = ? 
	AND DATE_FORMAT( t.gettime, '%Y-%m-%d' ) >= ? 
	AND DATE_FORMAT( t.gettime, '%Y-%m-%d' ) <= ? 
	AND t.`addtime` BETWEEN ? 
	AND ? 
	AND t.shard_time BETWEEN ? 
	AND ? 
GROUP BY
	t.id 
ORDER BY
	duration DESC`

Because when it run `ServerPreparedStatement#serverExecute` ,  **originalSql** is not contain sql "on duplicate ..." .
We should concat  the last sql by  add `SQLToken` when it run `OnDuplicateKeyColumnsFiller#fill`.

@strongduanmu my last answer may be a bit off topic. According to the ClassCastException caused by DATE_FORMAT(), I couldn’t find the SQL that was reported at the time, so now I am using version 4.0.1, which is good for me Enough.

It's a bug and fix in master branch now. https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/5857
You can wait for 5.0.0-rc1 or modify it as:
> SELECT count(*) FROM  table1 WHERE  deleted_at IS NULL

or
> SELECT count(*) FROM  table1 as a1 WHERE  a1.deleted_at IS NULL

Could you show more details for your question.
Such as sharding-jdbc or proxy, version, and which class you mentioned ?
Will update the code as per review. Thanks!

> @menghaoranss I have fixed the bad commits.
> Please review the changes now. Also, wanted to check if the `thread-id` logic used is ok and the `management-bean` would hold the info at class-load.
> I believe it should, but still wanted to be doubly sure.

@swayamraina there are conflicting files, please check.

@moses-keqi Hi
> nested exception is java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.shardingsphere.shardingjdbc.jdbc.core.datasource.EncryptDataSource cannot be cast to org.apache.shardingsphere.shardingjdbc.jdbc.core.datasource.ShardingDataSource

These parts of the log can not give us some useful hints, so more detailed logs are needed.
Besides, At first glance, it looks like you mix up the `ShardingRule` and `EncryptRule.` My suggestion is you'd better review your configuration referring to our document.

Thanks,
Trista

@larry0592 Hi 
Sorry to say currently we do not support this annotation, however, we welcome you or others to light up your mind and contribute it to this community. :)

Best wishes,
Trista

Hi @rudy2steiner Thanks for your prompt feedback. 
Although I merged this one, I am sorry to say it is not a perfect one, which means more polish is required.
For instance,

Do you think the grammar of this sentence is correct?
> In the last two years, the core developer spent much time maintaining and contributing to Apache ShardingSphere caused ElasticJob development slowly.

At least, it should be,
> In the last two years, the core developers spent much time maintaining and contributing to Apache ShardingSphere, **which** caused ElasticJob to develop slowly (or **caused slow development**).
Sorry, I will fix it by a new PR  if you not mind. we should polish it to be perfect as we can

Cheers,
Trista

I review the SQLParseEngine in shardingsphere-sql-parser, it has a big upgrade in 4.0.1, maybe the upgrade has some problem.
I hope to use 4.1.1 because it has long sql optimize. But 4.1.1 still not work for alias table.

Hi @larry0592 thanks for your feedback.
I looked at the log you provided once again. I guessed the key point is that ShardingPaser did not parse out the parameter in function properly, which has been fixed on our master branch already.

**Do you think my assumption is right or not?**
> insert into t_order (content, corp_id, create_time, create_time_str, info_type, remote_time, remote_time_str, status, user_id) values (HEX(AES_ENCRYPT(**?**, 'biocloud0592')), ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
Duplicate with https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/6212 .

遇到同样的问题
sharding-jdbc 3.1.0
flyway 5.2.4

> @swayamraina travis ci build failed, please check.

@menghaoranss fork branch was behind upstream. synced and CI is passing now.

We have received several similar reports about the slow startup recently, mostly due to loading unconfigured tables for meta data purpose of ShardingSphere.

https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/6179 : 7000+ tables cost much time.
Similar issues: https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/6161 , https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/5755 , https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/5999 .

Loading table (column and index information) is expensive, there're 7 SQLs interactive for each table.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24643893/86317891-24003900-bc63-11ea-9bb9-9d6ffbaa0316.png)

After investigate, I found that for tables unconfigured will not use column or index information any more after loading. So we can omit this process. 

I also checked the relevant issue https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/4460 , which will load collation for all columns in every table. If a table is unconfigured, the route result must be single route, a single route will not need merge any more. If the resultset does not need to merge, it is irrelevant with cache of collation. So I think we can safely remove the loading of unconfigured tables now.

Note that all unconfigured table names still need to be loaded for routing logic, this can simply obtain from one SQL for each database.

We can accomplish the goal by several steps.

- [ ] Remove the load procedure for unconfigured tables.
- [ ] Remove the refresh procedure for unconfigured tables
- [ ] Remove the multi-thread logic for unconfigured tables. (Configured tables still use multi-thread)
- [ ] Load table names for unconfigured tables.
- [ ] Sync up the new load logic with orchestration module.
- [ ] Update the unit test cases.
